title: Drawing, Design for Entrance of  GIOL Shop in the Art Deco Syle, ca. 1925
title_raw: Design for Entrance of  GIOL Shop in the Art Deco Syle
medium: graphite, brush and white gouache, gray wash, pen and gold ink on gray paperboard
markings: At lower right of image, large [2 3/8  x 1 1/2 in.] shield-shaped Kilemnik stamp in blue [date in red]:  KILEMNICK E CIA/ 524 FLORIDA/ 21 Oct. 1927/V. T. 31 [REC?] 3648
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite below image, lower right:  Kilemnik y Cia; upper right:  168/B [encircled]; lower right:  O
description: Elaborate glass/crystal and wrought iron store facade with deep entrance.  Hanging in entrance, a glass/crystal light fixture. On floor, a rectangular piece of wrought iron with abstract flower pattern.  On either side of central arched glass and wrought iron doorway (surrounded by a silver band) with shop name, triangular full-height window vitrines with wood (?) dado divided by silver band into rectangles on back wall.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, Design for Entrance of  GIOL Shop in the Art Deco Syle, ca. 1925. graphite, brush and white gouache, gray wash, pen and gold ink on gray paperboard. Gift of Maureen Cogan. 1999-39-16.
